title: Learn how to develop an R package
text: can install development version tester like :

title: Learn how to develop an R package
text: basic example shows solve common problem: special using README.Rmd instead just README.md? can include R chunks like : ’ll still need render README.Rmd regularly, keep README.md --date. devtools::build_readme() handy . can also embed plots, example:  case, don’t forget commit push resulting figure files, display GitHub CRAN.
code: library(tester) ## basic example code summary(cars) #>      speed           dist        #>  Min.   : 4.0   Min.   :  2.00   #>  1st Qu.:12.0   1st Qu.: 26.00   #>  Median :15.0   Median : 36.00   #>  Mean   :15.4   Mean   : 42.98   #>  3rd Qu.:19.0   3rd Qu.: 56.00   #>  Max.   :25.0   Max.   :120.00

title: Hello function — hello
code: hello("John") #> [1] "Hello John, this is the world!" if (FALSE) { hello("Steve") }

title: Silly Printer function — printer
text: x want first column r want second column

title: Sample Data for Analysis — sample_data
text: simple tibble simple testing running examples

title: Sample Data for Analysis — sample_data
text: tibble 2 column, : x random normal data y outcome normal based x

title: Read CSV duplicate — sample_read
code: csv = system.file("extdata", "sample_data.csv", package = "tester") sample_read(csv) #> Rows: 100 Columns: 2 #> ── Column specification ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Delimiter: "," #> dbl (2): x, y #>  #> ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data. #> ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message. #> # A tibble: 100 × 2 #>          x      y #>      <dbl>  <dbl> #>  1 -0.502  -1.34  #>  2  0.132   1.63  #>  3 -0.0789 -0.627 #>  4  0.887   2.62  #>  5  0.117  -1.22  #>  6  0.319   0.237 #>  7 -0.582  -1.94  #>  8  0.715   1.06  #>  9 -0.825  -0.410 #> 10 -0.360  -0.827 #> # ℹ 90 more rows
